BIO

After studying audio engineering in college, I interned at a post-production house, then I managed a recording studio. When the music industry took a severe downturn, I decided to leave the studio, and search for my next passion.

Soon, I began learning how to program, and I fell in love with coding. Thankfully, the skills I cultivated as a studio manager/recording engineer (figuring out how to troubleshoot issues, writing thorough documentation, asking substantive questions, using creativity to solve problems, and working with a team to accomplish common goals) have paid off.

In addition to programming, I love vintage gaming, synthesizers, mechanical keyboards, and my two dogs.
